column1: Older children and adults may sit with the head tilted toward the shoulder opposite the ear being examined.
Then, the tip of the otoscope will be placed gently into your ear.
An ear specialist may use a binocular microscope to get a magnified look at the ear.
Examining the ear also helps the provider see if treatment for an ear problem is working.
The ear canal may be red, tender, swollen, or filled with yellowish-green pus.
An infection can be spread from one ear to the other if the instrument used to look inside the ear has not been cleaned well.
